item.title: 1000cc Motorcycles Are Easier Than You Think Big bikes get a bad rep, but here’s the truth: 1000cc bikes are some of the easiest to ride. Why? Because 1st and 2nd gear cover almost everything you need in city traffic and slow-speed situations. Tons of tor

item.title: Having multiple bikes is awesome… But choosing which one to ride? That’s a problem I didn’t see coming—yet I fully welcome it. Each bike has its own personality, its own mood, its own kind of fun. Some days I want smooth and chill. Other days? I want loud

item.author: cliffy_jr

item.title: Lane Splitting Tip: Keep your speed no more than 10 to 15 mph faster than traffic. Going double the speed is asking for trouble. It cuts your reaction time and puts you in danger when cars make sudden moves. Stay smooth, stay predictable, and ride like ev

item.title: Lane splitting isn’t as dangerous as it looks—when it’s done right. In many places, it’s legal and even safer than sitting in stop-and-go traffic. The key is how you do it. Tips for safer splitting: • Keep your speed no more than 10–15 mph faster than tr

item.author: cliffy_jr

item.title: Is lane splitting legal in California? Yes—it is. California is the only U.S. state where lane splitting is explicitly legal under state law. That said, legal doesn’t mean reckless. Split smart, split safe, and stay predictable. #motorcycle #LaneSplitting
item.description: Is lane splitting legal in California? Yes—it is. California is the only U.S. state where lane splitting is explicitly legal under state law. That said, legal doesn’t mean reckless. Split smart, split safe, and stay predictable. #motorcycle #LaneSplitting

item.title: When to Shift: Mastering the Right Time Knowing when to shift is a core skill every rider needs to develop. While the best timing can vary by bike and riding style, there are two primary ways to know when it's time to change gears. 1. By the Tachometer (R

item.title: When traveling at speed it is a great idea to use a rev match to downshift. That way you can avoid any drag from the back wheel and avoid uncomfortable shifting. A rev match is fairly simple, pull in the clutch - add a little throttle - downshift -slowly
item.description: When traveling at speed it is a great idea to use a rev match to downshift. That way you can avoid any drag from the back wheel and avoid uncomfortable shifting. A rev match is fairly simple, pull in the clutch - add a little throttle - downshift -slowly
item.author: cliffy_jr

item.title: Where there’s smoke there are distracted drivers. Be careful when you’re riding near any visual distractions. It’s only natural to want to look and see what’s going on but don’t get distracted yourself. #motorcycle #distracted #distracteddriver #fire #smo
item.description: Where there’s smoke there are distracted drivers. Be careful when you’re riding near any visual distractions. It’s only natural to want to look and see what’s going on but don’t get distracted yourself. #motorcycle #distracted #distracteddriver #fire #smo

item.title: Rolling right turns do not need to be scary. Just maintain your speed at an appropriate level. Push your shoulder to the side that you’re turning and look all the way through the turn. Accelerate as you’re exiting the turn. #Motorcycle #Motorcycles #right
item.description: Rolling right turns do not need to be scary. Just maintain your speed at an appropriate level. Push your shoulder to the side that you’re turning and look all the way through the turn. Accelerate as you’re exiting the turn. #Motorcycle #Motorcycles #right
item.author: cliffy_jr

item.title: When riding a motorcycle, do your best to not get distracted but also to be able to recognize when other people are distracted. Gotta stay safe out there. #Motorcycles #Motorcycle #Smoke #Fire

item.title: Getting gas on a Honda rebel 1100. Motorcycles have much smaller tanks than cars, obviously, but they are much more fuel efficient as well. I wish this bike had a 3 gallon tank so that way I wouldn’t have to worry about gas, but I’m happy with what I have
